description: From New Latin marginālia (cf. margināle (neuter singular (adjective / noun)), from Medieval Latin neuter plural of marginālis (“on the periphery”), from Latin margō (“border, edge”). Compare margin.

entries.meaning: Notes in the margin of a document. [from 1830s]
examples: We know what the composer was thinking as he wrote the piece because we can read his handwritten marginalia on the manuscript.
